options.title: -a array
options.description: assign the words read to sequential indices of the array variable ARRAY, starting at zero

options.title: -d delim
options.description: continue until the first character of DELIM is read, rather than newline

options.title: -e
options.description: use Readline to obtain the line

options.title: -i text
options.description: use TEXT as the initial text for Readline

options.title: -n nchars
options.description: return after reading NCHARS characters rather than waiting for a newline, but honor a delimiter if fewer than NCHARS characters are read before the delimiter

options.title: -N nchars
options.description: return only after reading exactly NCHARS characters, unless EOF is encountered or read times out, ignoring any delimiter

options.title: -p prompt
options.description: output the string PROMPT without a trailing newline before attempting to read

options.title: -r
options.description: do not allow backslashes to escape any characters

options.title: -s
options.description: do not echo input coming from a terminal

options.title: -t timeout
options.description: time out and return failure if a complete line of input is not read within TIMEOUT seconds. The value of the TMOUT variable is the default timeout. TIMEOUT may be a fractional number. If TIMEOUT is 0, read returns immediately, without trying to read any data, returning success only if input is available on the specified file descriptor. The exit status is greater than 128 if the timeout is exceeded

options.title: -u fd read from file descriptor FD instead of the standard input
